definition: Nelson Mandela (1918-2013), South African ANC politician, president of South Africa 1994-1999
handsome/large/long
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]
virtue/goodness/morality/ethics/kindness/favor/character/kind
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

sentences.english: I think of Nelson Mandela, who has spent his life upholding the rights of others.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲納爾遜曼德拉，她用畢生維護他人的權利。

sentences.english: When tragedy strikes, Mandira is devastated and they split.
sentences.chinese: 當悲劇罷工，曼德拉就是他們分裂和破壞。

sentences.english: In the tower, MoJiaNa with mandela control step by step Gwens soul.
sentences.chinese: 在塔裏，莫佳娜用曼德拉根一步步控制格溫的靈魂。

sentences.english: He can convey the force of personality, the charm and the charisma.
sentences.chinese: 他能傳達出曼德拉的人格魅力和感召力。

sentences.english: According to the recipe, the amber and the mandrake berries are added last.
sentences.chinese: 按照配方所言，琥珀與曼德拉草果實應當最後加入。

sentences.english: He is Nelson Mandela and that is why we forgive.
sentences.chinese: 他是曼德拉，一個告訴我們爲何寬恕的人。

sentences.english: The village is situated not far from the lake above and was founded in 1900.
sentences.chinese: 這個村莊離伊曼德拉湖不遠，始建於1900年。

sentences.english: In 1990, after 27 years in prison, Nelson Rolihlahla Mandela was finally released.
sentences.chinese: 1990年，過了27年牢獄生活的曼德拉出獄了。

sentences.english: Zenani was one of Mr Mandela's nine great-grandchildren.
sentences.chinese: 澤娜尼是曼德拉九個曾孫輩後代中的一個。

sentences.english: The South African government confirmed today that the words used in the foreword were Mandela's.
sentences.chinese: 南非政府今日證實了前言中的話確實是曼德拉所說。

sentences.english: What does she think will happen when Mandela dies?
sentences.chinese: 曼德拉去世，她認爲會有什麼發生呢？

sentences.english: You can have a peek at Mandela's house -- now a museum.
sentences.chinese: 曼德拉舊居現已成爲一座博物館。

sentences.english: In a few hours, the Mandrake Draught will be ready.
sentences.chinese: 在幾個小時之內，曼德拉藥水就將配製好了。

sentences.english: When I go to meet a friend by the pool at the Mandalay Bay, it's too crowded to find chairs.
sentences.chinese: 我去曼德拉灣見朋友，那裏人滿爲患，座位都找不到。

sentences.english: Zenani Mandela, 13, was killed in an auto accident early on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 安妮，曼德拉今年13歲，在上週五一車禍中喪生。

sentences.english: Mandela had indeed neither read the book nor written a foreword.
sentences.chinese: 曼德拉確實既未讀過此書，也不曾爲該書作序。

definition: Martin Luther King, Jr. (1929-1968), American clergyman and civil rights activist
Mohammed Abdel Rahman Abdel Raouf Arafat al-Qudwa al-Husseini (1929-2004), Palestinian leader, popularly known as Yasser Arafat 亞西爾·阿拉法特|亚西尔·阿拉法特[Ya4 xi1 er3 · A1 la1 fa3 te4]
Robert Mugabe (1924-), Zimbabwean ZANU-PF politician, president of Zimbabwe 1987-2017
(Mahatma) Gandhi
apartheid
Kennedy (name)/J.F. Kennedy (1917-1963), US Democrat politician, president 1961-1963
General Augusto Pinochet (1915-2006), Chilean dictator
George Byron (1788-1824), English poet
Fidel (name)
Jefferson/capital of Missouri
Alexandr Solzhenitsyn (1918-2008), Russian writer, prominent Soviet dissident, author of the Gulag Archipelago
Leon Davidovich Trotsky (1879-1940), early Bolshevik leader, exiled by Stalin in 1929 and murdered in 1940
Roosevelt (name)/Theodore Roosevelt (1858-1919), US President 1901-1909/Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945), US President 1933-1945
Ernesto Che Guevara (1928-1967), Cuban Revolution leader
Anwar Al Sadat
Suharto (1921-2008), former Indonesian general, president of the Republic of Indonesia 1967-1998
